title: Education Specialist (Yonkers)
description:
**EDUCATION SPECIALIST (HEAD START, EARLY HEAD START)**

FSW’s Head Start program is a federally-funded program founded in 1996 to serve infants and toddlers under the age of 3, as well as pregnant women. The goal of Early Head Start is to provide child development and family support services to low-income pregnant women, infants, toddlers and their families.

Under the supervision of the Education Specialist oversees and directs the planning, organizing, and implementation of education services for children. These services contribute to the increased social competence in children and the recognition and enhancement of parents as the primary educators of their children.

* Monitor and implement the curriculum for Early Head Start and Head Start classrooms.
* Support and supervise all classroom practices - room arrangement, lesson plans, daily schedules, routines, and transitions to assure their adherence to program policies;
* Supervise and monitor child’s ongoing anecdotal record-keeping, assessments, home visits and conferences in COPA and Teaching Strategies Gold.
* Provide CLASS observations for the classrooms.
* Assists classroom staff in a system for maintaining an inventory of classroom materials and supplies that is checked at least annually.
* Assists teaching staff in understanding and interpreting child observation data and establishing appropriate individual child goals based on knowledge of child development.
* Assists teaching staff in developing a system which offers parents opportunities for enhancing their skills as first educator of their children through the use of home learning activities, family nights, planning educational activities and providing opportunities to volunteer, attending training, etc.
* Assist the education manager in implements active supervision strategies that ensure children are supervised and never alone including the positioning of staff and zoning, scanning and counting children, listening to children, anticipating children’s behavior and engaging and redirecting children using developmentally appropriate practices.
* Regular and predicable attendance is a requirement of the job.

Regular and predictable attendance is required

Additional duties as assigned by the Education Manager

**COMMUNICATION**

* Work cooperatively with other component coordinators to plan education services integrated with health, mental health, dental health, nutrition, parent involvement, and social services;
* Assist individual staff members in identifying their training needs, and improving their knowledge and abilities;
* Complete and submit required reports to immediate supervisor in a timely and accurate fashion
* Provides information for the collection of data for the submission of the PIR (e.g., COPA, etc.).

**PLANNING**

* Support children’s transition from EHS to HS or HS to Kindergarten.
* Attend meetings involving staff, families and administrative support as requested.
* Identify and prioritize materials and equipment needed in classrooms and playgrounds with the site directors.
* Assist individual staff members in identifying their training needs, and improving their knowledge and abilities;
* Assist education manager deliver pre-service and monthly in-service training sessions to teaching staff;

**COMPLIANCE MANAGEMENT**

* Monitor and review education files for the fall, winter and spring term. All required documents are in the education files. Assure that all files are completed, accurate, and confidentially maintained;
* Support and monitor’s teacher’s development and implementation of their study plan for a CDA, Associates, Bachelor’s or certification.
* Support and assist site director with evaluating the performance of teaching staff.
* Actively participate in the development and implementation of the Teacher Professional Development Plan;
* Understands, generates and documents in-kind and other allowable costs applied toward the non-federal share requirement.
* Responsible for understanding Head Start Performance Standards and local childcare licensing regulations.
* Maintains strict confidentiality with respect to Head Start/Early Head Start children, families and staff in accordance with established policies and procedures.

**EDUCATION**

* A Bachelor’s degree required
* Bilingual (Spanish/English) is a plus

**SKILLS**

* Requires effective writing and oral communication skills to conduct meetings and training sessions, and to prepare reports that are clear, complete, comprehensive;
* Manual dexterity sufficient to operate a computer (Microsoft word, excel, etc.) and office equipment, including, but not limited to, the telephone, fax machine, and copier;
* Knowledge of family-centered practices and local resources, customs, and language is helpful.
* Ability to know and implement the Head Start Performance Standards and requirements
* Ability to exercise professional judgment in evaluating before making decisions,
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff, children, parents, outside agencies, and the public,
* Ability to maintain strict confidentiality at all times, including recognizing situations in which confidentiality is required.
* Requires ability to use abstract reasoning, problem solving, planning, and analytical skills in: training, evaluation, and program development.
* Demonstrated ability to perform multiple tasks effectively in a fast-paced, challenging, and constantly changing environment.
* WORK AUTHORIZATION IS REQUIRED

**EXPERIENCE**

3+ years’ experience related to education services in early childhood programs for young children and families from diverse backgrounds.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Bending and lifting up to 25 pounds may be required.
* Travel may be required to attend conferences, meetings, and other duties at distant locations.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**

* Sitting for long period of time (during planning and reporting) and standing for long periods of time (during observations and training), as well as stooping, squatting, and running;
* Frequent contact with staff and representatives of outside agencies, Head Start families, and children
* Attends all workshops and meetings as deemed necessary by the immediate supervisor.
* Attends all required staff and parent meetings and activities.

Required adherence to OCFS child care regulations and HS performance standards regarding program operations, facilities, and federal administrative requirements.

At FSW, we enjoy working in a collaborative, mission-driven environment and value the benefits of a diversified workplace that prioritizes our clients and the communities we serve. If you want to make a difference in the lives of thousands of people across the communities of Westchester County, and if the Education Specialist position speaks to your capabilities, experience and commitment to social service, please apply through Indeed.com. Qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or email.

*Family Services of Westchester, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.*

description:

THE OPPORTUNITY
The Visual Designer position reports directly to the Director of Creative Services in the Trade Marketing department. Working with a team of marketers and designers, the visual designer is responsible for creating a wide range of materials to promote children’s books for toddlers, middle-graders, and teens in support of our marketing, publicity, sales, and conventions teams. This position has a broad scope and successful candidates will ideally have working knowledge in graphic design for print and web, social media design, and animation.
The ideal candidate is highly creative, self-motivated, and comfortable working in a fast-paced, friendly environment independently and within a team. The candidate is highly organized and able to multitask. They must be able to execute design solutions based on initial conceptual and visual direction. Excellent typography skills and experience building files to finished production standards using the most current Adobe Creative Suite programs are a must.
RESPONSIBILITIES* Help conceive/produce great ideas and design based on creative briefs and marketing strategy
* Develop design concepts independently and collaboratively, working closely with all levels of the creative team, including project managers, and art directors
* Design a variety of print materials, including advertisements, logos, posters, postcards, POP, bookmarks, invitations, signage, catalogs, and sell sheets
* Design a variety of digital marketing assets including website banner ads, graphics, social media posts, and animated gifs
* Prepare print and digital files for production


WHO WE ARE
Scholastic Corporation (NASDAQ: SCHL) is the world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books, a leading provider of core literacy curriculum and professional services, and a producer of educational and entertaining children's media. The Company creates quality books and ebooks, print and technology-based learning programs for pre-K to grade 12, classroom magazines and other products and services that support children's learning both in school and at home. With operations in 14 international offices and exports to 165 countries, Scholastic makes quality, affordable books available to all children around the world through school-based book clubs and book fairs, classroom collections, school and public libraries, retail and online. True to its mission of 100+ years to encourage the personal and intellectual growth of all children beginning with literacy, the Company has earned a reputation as a trusted partner to educators and families. Learn more at www.scholastic.com.
Some benefits that we offer:* Full suite of health and wellness benefits (including a $0 deductible Medical Plan)
* Retirement Savings Plan 401(k) with options for both Roth and Traditional Contributions
* Tuition-Free programs for undergraduate and graduate degrees
* Generous Parental Leave Program
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) with opportunity for discounted stock at a 15% discount


Thank you for your consideration in choosing Scholastic.

* Exceptional organizational and time management skills, including the ability to multitask, shift priorities when needed, work well under pressure, meet tight deadlines, and react quickly and smoothly to changes

title: Account Executive
description:
**Job description**

Jayce Grayye Consulting is seeking an experienced Account Executive for one of our clients. Our client is the leading conversation intelligence software for outside sales, serving industries like HVAC, solar, and window sales. Their mobile app records and analyzes face-to-face sales conversations to help improve sales performance. Their vision is to make the offline world of commerce as searchable as the internet.

They are growing 20% MoM, with hundreds of clients, including Fortune 500 companies, a Net Revenue Retention above 170%, an NPS higher than the iPhone’s, and they are cash flow positive. They are one of the fastest-growing startups globally and historically, backed by Byron Deeter from Bessemer Venture Partners, the top Cloud investor in the world, and recognized as a Cloud 100 Rising Star company.

**Who you are**

* A customer obsessive: You deeply care about delighting customers and solving their pains, not vanity metrics.
* An infinite learner: You're always looking to learn more and faster, feeling uneasy when complacent. Constantly seeking discomfort.
* A team player: You thrive on giving and receiving feedback, learning, and growing as a team.
* Unafraid of failure: You take risks, see failure as an opportunity to learn and grow, and aren’t afraid to try unconventional ideas. The unconventional excites you.
* Extremely focused: You practice extreme focus in everything you do, always prioritizing your time and resources for maximum efficiency.

Their operating principle is to run like a high-speed reinforcement learner: a machine learning algorithm that plays a game millions of times to become invincible in a short amount of time.

**The role**

“Startup equals growth” - Paul Graham.

In their case, growth equals sales.

Since they began selling in 2022, they’ve grown 89% month-over-month, and continue to grow at 30% MoM after surpassing seven figures in Annual Recurring Revenue.

They are growing insanely fast, but still not quickly enough.

They have so much demand for their product that they don’t have the time to close all the leads coming through their pipeline.

Your job will be to help them grow faster.

You will be hopping on customer demos, doing follow-up meetings, closing deals, and evangelizing their gospel of conversation intelligence for the physical world.

**What will I be doing in my day-to-day?**

* Work closely with potential customers from initial contact to deal close.
* Maintain a healthy sales pipeline and keep momentum.
* Conduct sales presentations and demos.
* Provide weekly forecasts.
* Close around 10 mid-market customers a month.
* Work on a few large enterprise deals.
* Evangelize the power of conversation intelligence for the physical world to your network.
* Attend events to connect with potential customers.
* Sales is a product: You will be one of the product managers of the client’s sales engine. It is your responsibility to help optimize their sales product by developing and executing new ideas to enhance the sales funnel.
* Generate your own pipeline by prospecting on LinkedIn, networks, referrals, and existing customers.
* Always keep learning.

**Skills & Requirements**

* 2+ years of quota-carrying sales experience in SaaS.
* Comfortable selling to Sales Directors, C-suite level, and VP-level buyers.
* Demonstrated strong work ethic, resiliency, discipline, and coachability.
* Proven record of consistently hitting quota in previous role(s).
* Exceptional communication skills via text, email, phone, Zoom, and in person.
* Intelligent, competitive, detail-oriented, resourceful, persistent, team player, and eternally optimistic.

**Nice to haves**

* Experience selling other conversation intelligence software like Gong, Chorus, Avoma, or Balto.ai.
* Experience in a competitive, high-feedback environment, e.g., college sports.
* Experience selling SaaS in the home improvement/home service industry, e.g., ServiceTitan.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $79,425.00 - $90,722.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental Pay:

* Commission pay

Application Question(s):

* A prospective client tells you she has used your main competitor for 10 years and likes their product.

What would you do?  
A. Ask what she would change about your competitor’s product  
B. Acknowledge the long-standing relationship, but tell her you should be her supplier  
C. Tell her about your product and leave a sample  
D. Highlight your competitor’s drawbacks and how your product is superior  
E. Thank her for her time and ask for referrals you can pursue

title: Structural Engineering Intern- Summer 2025
description:
This Opportunity


Nationally recognized as a Top 100 Internship Program, WSP USA hosts hundreds of interns across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.


Our Transportation Team is seeking a Full Time Structural Engineering Intern to work out of our Lawrenceville, NJ office. This temporary position is seeking individuals currently enrolled in an Undergraduate or Graduate degree program.


This internship will be part of the WSP Summer Internship Program. As a summer intern, you have the opportunity to participate in our 12-week program scheduled to start on May 19th, 2025. The individual start date of the internship may be flexible.  

  



Your Impact


* Support a variety of engineering tasks with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.
* Learn basic principles of Structural Engineering.
* Assist with project research, field work, and preliminary design calculations and analysis.
* Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.
* Assist in collecting and maintaining project documentation.
* Complete training on assigned tasks.
* Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.
* Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.
* Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.

Who You Are


**Required Qualifications**

* Actively enrolled in an accredited Structural Engineering, or related, Undergraduate program with an anticipated graduation date of August 2025 or later.
* Must be 18 or older.
* Demonstrated interest in Structural Engineering, or related field, and have a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.
* Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.
* Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.
* Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.
* Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug/alcohol and harassment policies.
* Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience using AutoCAD and Microsoft Office Tools.
* Prior internship and leadership involvement on campus.

  

  

  
**About WSP**WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper.


www.wsp.com


WSP provides a flexible and agile workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.


At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?


WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race/Age/Color/Religion/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin/Disability or Protected Veteran Status.


The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.


**NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES:**

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters, employment agencies, or other staffing services. Unsolicited resumes include any resume or hiring document sent to WSP in the absence of a signed Service Agreement where WSP has expressly requested recruitment/staffing services specific to the position at hand. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers or other business leaders, will become the property of WSP and WSP will have the right to hire that candidate without reservation – no fee or other compensation will be owed or paid to the recruiter, employment agency, or other staffing service.

title: Project Accountant
description:
This Opportunity


Experienced senior-level project accountant professional providing accounting and financial specialist support to one or more Project Managers and/or project team(s). Develops project work breakdown structure, project budgets, margin analysis, and creates associated funding in Oracle for larger and/or more complex projects. Ancillary important tasks include evaluating project charges, completing cost transfers, ensuring that all project data in Oracle is up-to-date, generating robust project accounting reporting for infrastructure / transportation / professional services projects, and working with project leadership on recommendations for addressing problem project corrective strategies. Also works collaboratively with the Billing function and project managers on pre-billing information review, cost estimates, and invoicing. Ensures that responsibilities are delivered and adhered to with a level of quality that meets or exceeds acceptable industry standards, supporting the delivery of future-ready solutions to clients.


Your Impact


* For assigned project(s), manage and analyze the collection, recording, and allocating of project costs and revenue, ensuring accurate project profit and loss calculations, and communicating project financial performance and profitability to project/program management.
* Responsible for lifecycle project accounting from creating project accounts in Oracle, to tracking projects and project budget, validating invoicing, project close-out, and reconciling overall project payables and receivables to project budgets.
* Perform detailed and involved accounting tasks related to managing project contract, billing events and billing transaction exceptions revenue for larger and/or multi-faceted complex projects.
* Partner with the Project Manager and project team to establish the project budget, updating budgets, and making project accounting recommendations as needed when contract modifications or budget changes arise.
* Generate project financial reports and visualization, evaluating the reports for accurate presentation of data and findings, including developing analysis on labor breakage, cost trending or other various project related financial reports to be escalated for review by the Project or Finance Management.
* Monitor and analyze revenue and unbilled balances to ensure proper revenue recognition.
* Authorize access to project accounts, and the transfer of expenses into and out of project-related accounts in compliance with established accounting practices and guidelines.
* Maintain quality control standards and procedures for generating accurate and precise project-related financial records using Oracle, spreadsheets, and software.
* For assigned projects, apply learned accounting expertise relating to project resources, labor and expenses, investigating project variances and submitting variance reports to management.
* Verify contract and change order characteristics for projects that are large and /or of a higher level of complexity, including reading and interpreting contract language, method of compensation, modifications, purchase orders, and subcontract/consultant terms.
* Monitor key indicators for managing and analyzing problem projects, keeping project managers and/or project accounting manager informed on any noted concerns.
* Responsible for ensuring draft invoices from billing are accurate based on the contract requirements agreed upon with the client, identify any corrections needed, obtain Project Manager documentation and signature, finalize the invoice approval with the Project Manager/billing team and submits the invoice to the client.
* Subcontract management and coordination with Contract Administrators. This includes evaluating subcontractor invoice submittals for accuracy, establishes and maintains purchase orders for subconsultants, and requests and follows up on subcontractor payment requests with Accounts Payable.
* Identify and record unpaid contract billings, following up on any delinquent accounts receivable and/or unbilled costs.
* Respond to requests for more detail from clients, investigate all project expenses not billed to clients, and create or approve all project-related billings to clients.
* Attend or coordinate project-related meetings to inform the team regarding the current status of project financials, articulating problem projects and following up on any identified actions as discussed.
* Create and submit government reports related to projects.
* Compile information for internal and external auditors and formal audit responses as required.
* Work with cross-functional finance teams (e.g. Billing, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Project Set-Up) in executing project work.
* Comply with regulatory requirements pertaining to the data integrity, documentation, procedures, training, monitoring systems, and record compliance and retention.
* Interact with regulatory agencies, subcontractors, and clients in a confident and professional manner.
* Mentor and/or train other project accountants and/or interns as needed, including reviewing of billing and project budgets to perform QA/QC.
* Remain current in latest project accounting principles and subject matter.
* Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.
* Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.

Who You Are


**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business, or closely-related discipline (or demonstrated proven equivalent experience).
* 5 to 7 years of relevant post education experience in accounting, project contracts and change management documents.
* Proficient knowledge of project accounting principles, practices, and methods and their application to project work-related issues.
* Ability to make technical computations and calculations involving the application of accounting principles, understanding plans and specifications and making factual comparisons to the appropriate regulations and/or contract stipulations.
* Ability to coordinate with various stakeholders and understand contract requirements, scope, and schedule.
* Highly capable interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an accounting and non-accounting audience.
* Highly capable self-leadership with attention to detail, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.
* Ability to work independently and provide guidance and leadership to junior team or project members, with strict adherence to QA/QC.
* Advanced proficiency with technical writing, office automation and accounting software, technology, math principles, MS Excel, pivot tables, formulas, data format/sort/filter, VLOOKUP, predictive models, and tools.
* Developed critical thinking and problem-solving skills required to apply learned subject matter and technical knowledge to reach conclusions from testing results, data collation, statistical analysis and arriving at the most effective, economical, and logical solution.
* Ability to collaboratively and assertively work with others such as subcontractors, consultants, and clients on outstanding accounts receivables.
* Awareness of and adherence to WSP USA’s Project Delivery Handbook.
* Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug/alcohol and harassment policies.
* This is a professional role and as such work deadlines and work hours may extend beyond a typical workday.
* Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Master’s Degree is preferred (but not required).
* Familiarity with Oracle preferred (but not required).

#LI-GA1


  

  

  
**About WSP**WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. * Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.
* Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to executive projects.
* Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.
* Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug/alcohol and harassment policies.
* Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Actively enrolled in an accredited Mechanical Engineering, or related, Masters or PhD program with an anticipated graduation date of August 2025 or later.
* Experience using AutoCAD or Revit
* Prior internship and leadership involvement on campus

**Compensation:**  

  

Expected Salary (all locations): $20.48 - $29.20

WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper.


www.wsp.com


WSP provides a flexible and agile workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.


At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?

title: Home Infusion Registered Nurse
description:
**Job Description**

The Registered Nurse will assess, plan, educate (patient, family, caregivers when needed), and administer direct patient care for infusion and related therapies. The Registered Nurse is responsible for providing direct skilled nursing services to patients according to Physician orders, policies & procedures, and in accordance with RN scope of practice. The Registered Nurse is responsible to contact patients, family members, physicians, pharmacies, or even emergency medical services as and when needed. The Registered Nurse is responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures of the Integrated Home Infusions, Infusion industry standards, and in compliance with OSHA, and HIPAA guidelines.

**Responsibilities**

* Assure quality care by adhering to the Policy & Procedures of Integrated Home Infusions and Infusion industry standards.
* Provide care education to patients in person or over the phone
* Adhere to compliance guidelines throughout processes (OSHA, FDA, HIPAA)

**Requirements**

* Active CPR Certificate
* Nursing Diploma from an Accredited Nursing Program
* State issued or approved for use within the state and active Registered Nurse
* NJ License without any sanctions or restrictions
* Proof of Immunization records (Measles, Mumps, Rubella, Varicella, Hepatitis B
* Proof of a negative PPD or QuantiFERON upon hire
* ***1-year of recent experience placing Peripheral IV’s*** and performing Nursing assessments
* A minimum availability of one day per week which can include weekdays, weekends, daytime, and evenings
* Working laptop with free hard drive space for downloads, in all applicable updates

· Nurses will work within North Jersey

· Nursing positions requires nurses to visit patients at home and administer IV therapies and teach patients how to administer medications on their own

**Availability**

· Days, Evenings, and Weekends

**Rates**

· $35 During Training

· $40 - $50 an Hour Based on Experience

title: IT & Low Voltage Technician
description:
**Job Overview:**

Super-G, a leading IT agency in NYC, is seeking a motivated Low-Voltage Technician to join our growing team. We specialize in delivering top-notch technology solutions to residential and commercial clients across NYC, Long Island, Westchester, and parts of NJ. This role offers a long-term opportunity starting with a minimum of 16 hours per week, with potential for increased hours as the business expands.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Travel to client sites across NYC, Long Island, Westchester, and some areas of NJ.
* Work from home when not on-site, communicating effectively with internal teams and external clients to resolve technical issues.
* Install and configure IT/Low-Voltage equipment, including Network Switches, Management Devices, Access Points, CCTV Cameras, Monitors, Workstations, DVRs/NVRs, Backup Batteries, and more.
* Identify, pull, label, terminate, extend, and test network cabling, with a strong understanding of commercial-grade wiring topologies being preferred.
* Safely operate man lifts, hand tools, and power tools; work from ladders, scaffolds, or at heights above 25 feet.
* Perform site surveys according to job scope.
* Coordinate with 3rd party vendors, service providers, and other business units as required.
* Work independently without direct supervision.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in IT/Low-Voltage equipment installation and network cabling.
* Ability to travel across NYC, Long Island, Westchester, and some parts of NJ.
* Comfortable working from home when necessary.
* Experience with site surveys and vendor coordination is a plus.
* Willingness to undergo training for areas of limited experience.
* Must be pursuing a technology-related major if currently enrolled in college.
* Valid NYS Driver’s License with a clean driving record.

This role offers a collaborative work environment, opportunities for professional development, and the chance to work on exciting, diverse projects. If you're passionate about technology and looking for a challenging yet rewarding role, apply today to join the Super-G team!

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
Nibav Lifts Inc. is a leader in innovative home lift solutions, providing top-quality products that redefine mobility and comfort in residential spaces. We are committed to delivering exceptional customer service and maintaining a dynamic, forward-thinking work environment. As we continue to grow, we are seeking enthusiastic and dedicated individuals to join our team.
  
  

**Job Overview:**  

As a Warehouse Associate at Nibav Lifts Inc., you will be a key player in ensuring our warehouse operations run smoothly. You’ll be responsible for various tasks that contribute to the efficient receipt, storage, and distribution of our products. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment and takes pride in keeping things organized and running efficiently.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Receiving & Processing: Unload, inspect, and accurately document incoming shipments. Verify the quality and quantity of products received and ensure they are stored correctly.
* Inventory Management: Maintain accurate inventory records by regularly updating the system, conducting cycle counts, and ensuring products are correctly labeled and stored.
* Order Picking & Packing: Accurately pick and pack orders for shipment, ensuring all items meet quality standards before dispatch. Prepare and load products for delivery, following all safety protocols.
* Shipping: Prepare and label shipments for outbound delivery, coordinating with shipping carriers to ensure timely and accurate delivery.
* Equipment Operation: Safely operate warehouse equipment, including forklifts, pallet jacks, and other machinery, to move and store products (training provided if needed).
* Safety Compliance: Adhere to all safety guidelines and protocols, maintaining a clean and organized workspace. Report any safety concerns or equipment malfunctions immediately.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with other warehouse staff, logistics coordinators, and management to meet daily, weekly, and monthly operational goals.
* Quality Control: Conduct regular quality checks on products and packaging to ensure customer satisfaction.


**Qualifications:**  

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous experience in a warehouse or similar environment is preferred but not required.
* Ability to lift and move heavy objects (up to 50 lbs) on a regular basis.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work efficiently both independently and as part of a team.
* Good communication skills and a positive attitude.
* Basic computer skills for inventory management and order processing.
* Willingness to learn and adapt to new procedures and technologies.
* Flexibility to work overtime or weekends when needed.


**What We Offer:**  

* Competitive hourly wage with potential for overtime.
* Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance.
* 401(k) retirement plan with company match.
* Paid time off, including holidays and vacation days.
* Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
* A collaborative and supportive work environment where your contributions are valued.

title: General Manager
description:
At Parched Hospitality Group Inc. (PHG), we believe in putting people first - our team, our guests, and our community. Our core values revolve around warmth, hospitality, and inclusivity. We strive to create a friendly and laid-back environment, reflecting the spirit of Australian hospitality, where everyone is welcomed with a smile and treated with genuine care and respect.

As a restaurant group that is based in NYC and expanding, we own and manage several Australian-inspired upscale, casual dining concepts - Hole in the Wall Cafe, Isla & Co. Restaurant, The Sentry Rooftop, and Daintree Rooftop Bar & Lounge. At this time we are seeking a highly enthusiastic and energetic **General Manager** to oversee our **Isla & Co. Williamsburg** location.

The General Manager will work side-by-side with the Head Chef to lead the daily operations of the venue. As well as being responsible for the overall hospitality of the restaurant the GM will be accountable for executing the financial goals of the venue, the high service expectations and oversee the food and beverage program. They will be expected to work closely with the entire management team to ensure the operation is being executed at the high standards expected.

We are looking for strong leaders who have the ability to work calmly under pressure, communicate clearly and precisely, are quick to action and are excited to teach and develop staff working for them.

**What you will do:**

* Ensure excellent customer service from the entire team
* Ensure the entire team is up to date with PHG initiatives
* Help create and supervise a high performing team in a high volume environment
* Maintain an A grade and a above standard hygienic environment
* Increase sales and minimize costs across beverage, supply, & labor in conjunction with the Head Chef
* Ensure that all invoices, financial reporting, payroll and personnel related administrative duties are completed accurately and on time
* Work with management and operations team to drive marketing opportunities
* Identify operational and/or service issues and take prompt corrective action where necessary or suggest alternative courses of action
* Manage all customer service responses
* Ensure a safe work environment across all departments
* Execute daily decision making, scheduling, training and planning while upholding standards, product quality and cleanliness.
* Build and maintain strong positive relationships with all key stakeholders (i.e. corporate leadership, operating partners, vendors).
* Ensure all required licenses and permits are up-to-date.
* Oversee:
* Floor management including maintaining proper flow of service throughout the cafe while upholding service standards, product quality and cleanliness ensuring continuous communication with kitchen and all FOH staff and guest interaction
* Working with events team and FOH on planning and executing events
* Creating relationships with new and returning guests
* Work with management team on succession planning for all staff
* Creating and executing training practices for all FOH management and staff based on company standards
* Ensure ongoing development of staff by creating performance expectations, ongoing feedback, and consistent performance reviews
* Oversee all FOH terminations and disciplinary action
* Establish appropriate labor costs to drive efficiency
* Ensure all management and staff have a strong knowledge of food and beverage menus, as well as developing offerings.

**What you need to have:**

* 8+ years of restaurant/cafe experience
* 5+ years of restaurant/cafe management experience
* In depth knowledge of hospitality financial reporting including weekly P&Ls and expense reports
* Exceptional service skills
* Outstanding food and beverage knowledge - particularly in specialty espresso beverages (preferred)
* Food Handler’s Certification
* Strong ability to multitask
* Self-motivated
* Problem solving & delegation
* Familiarity of the local cafe scene (preferred)
* Excellent initiative & follow through
* Excellent verbal & written communication
* Attention to detail
* Understanding of restaurant/cafe POS systems
* Multilingual English and Spanish looked favourably on

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* Base salary starting at $80,000
* KPI Based Bonus Structure (Annual Bonus Potential $12,500)
* 401k Benefits
* 3 Weeks Paid Time Off
* Contribution towards monthly Health and Dental and Vision Insurance
* Dining credits and Discounts throughout all Parched venues
* Career Growth Opportunities

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $80,000.00 per year

Application Question(s):

* Have you worked as a GM of a restaurant before? If so, where?

Experience:

* Restaurant management: 6 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11249 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Insurance Risk Manager
company_industry: Energy And Utilities, Banks And Financial Services
description:
Insurance Risk Manager  


PBF Energy Inc. (NYSE:PBF) is one of the largest independent refiners in North America, operating through its subsidiaries, oil refineries and related facilities. We are seeking a talented Insurance Risk Manager to join our team as a pivotal member that would play a key role here at PBF Energy. This role would be located onsite at our Company headquarters in Parsippany, NJ.
The Corporate Insurance Risk Manager supports the Vice President of Investor Relations, Insurance Risk Management and is responsible for daily administration and annual review of Company’s insurance portfolio working strategically, effectively and cross-functionally with all business units; assisting with insurance issues relating to contract and insurance coverages and working with key internal & external stakeholders on insurance procurement and compliance. Accountable for achieving strategic objectives, ensuring effective hazard (typically insurable risks) risk management for the organization.
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:* Manage Company’s Commercial Property, Builders Risk, Casualty, Management Liability, Marine, Surety, Cyber and international (if applicable) insurance programs.
* Coordinate with Company’s insurance brokers to ensure assigned insurance policies are placed and renewed to meet business need aligned with company’s insurance strategy.
* Understand and convey company’s risk profile to insurance carriers to achieve competitive pricing for necessary insurance coverages.
* Work with key business heads to establish and quantify the organization’s risk appetite, i.e. level of risk the Company are prepared to accept and recommending appropriate line insurance coverage & limits.
* Establish and maintain all 3rd party service provider relationships including insurance markets and brokers.
* Serve as primary resource for the Commercial Insurance Programs to communicate with internal functions including EH&S, Operations, Treasury/Credit, IT Business Development, Commercial, HR, Legal, Finance and refinery/logistics operations.
* Review proposed contracts and provide advice to stakeholders on necessary provisions to align contract terms with insurance obligations and restrictions.
* Develop insurance programs to support new business initiatives.
* Manage exposure-to-risk claims programs to ensure the proper and efficient handling of claims, gathering data on claims for both record keeping and loss forecasting purposes.
* Participate & key member of all M&A transactions providing pre/post insurance due diligence.


QUALIFICATIONS:* 10+ years of experience as a corporate risk manager and/or broker, preferably in energy sector
* Exposure to a broad range of line of commercial insurance
* Experience with alternative risk transfer and risk financing structures
* Possess excellent business judgment, communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to provide sound financial and business judgement, strategic thinking and broad financial and business perspective across the organization
* Highly effective in setting priorities with excellent organization and time management skills
* Must possess strong quantitative and analytical skills
* Experience working with insurance carriers, adjusters, forensic accountants, third party administrators and brokers.
* Travel 15-20%
* ONLY CANDIDATES MEETING THE ABOVE REQUIREMENTS WILL BE CONSIDERED.
* FOR SERIOUS CONSIDERATION, PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR SALARY REQUIREMENTS.

*We thank all respondents for their interest in PBF Holding Company LLC (“PBF Energy”), however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please no phone calls or emails to any employee of PBF Energy about this requisition. Placement agencies or recruiters need not respond. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee of PBF Energy via email, the Internet or in any method without a valid written search agreement will be deemed the sole property of PBF Energy. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by PBF Energy as a result of the referral or through other means.**PBF Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We* *are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, reproductive health decision making, national origin, ancestry, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, age, veteran and military status, or any other status protected by applicable law.* *We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations as required by law.*

title: Construction Inspector
description:

* Project Duration - One year, Potential to extend
* Location - Battery Park, Manhattan, NY


  

Who We Are: Infinite Consulting Corp. is a project, program, and construction management firm established in 2009 specializing in safety management, quality management, project and construction management, and project controls. We proudly provide the highest level of service and support at each phase of our client's projects. Our client's success is our success.  

  

We put people first and we've created a culture that attracts professional, passionate, and caring individuals who are actively working together to solve problems. As a team member with Infinite, you’re visible. You are heard. You can expect to make a difference through your work and to have a direct impact on achieving our mission: to safely build tomorrow.  

  

Ready to join our team? We offer a generous benefits package for eligible employees and lots of room for career growth.  

  

Role and Responsibilities-  

 We are currently seeking an experienced Construction Inspector to support in the new work for the South Battery Park Association. There are different packages: Flood walls, new building, park renovations for this project.  

Responsibilities:  

* Conduct thorough inspections to ensure compliance with construction codes and specifications.
* Provide expertise in your specific focus area specifically in civil and Flood walls, new buildings, and park renovations to ensure the highest quality work.
* Collaborate with contractors, engineers, and other stakeholders to address issues and provide constructive feedback.

Requirements:  

* Degree in engineering or construction management highly preferred; or equivalent work experience/certifications.

* Minimum 5+ years of proven experience as a Construction Inspector in the respective focus area.
* Strong knowledge of construction practices, techniques, construction codes, and regulations.
* Ability to perform quantity and engineering computations, read and interpret plans and specifications; and understand the fundamentals of necessary inspection codes and requirements for material testing.
* Strong attention to detail and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.

We encourage everybody to find causes they are passionate about and look for ways to make a difference. Take a look and see how we are giving back to www.infinitecares.co

title: Lead .NET Developer
description:
**Infosys is seeking a Lead .NET Developer.** In the role, you will interface with key stakeholders and apply your technical proficiency across different stages of the software development Life Cycle in.NET application. You will also be expected to build high-throughput, fault tolerant systems with requirements including elicitation, application architecture, definition, and design. You will play an important role in creating the high-level design artifacts. You will also deliver high quality code deliverables for a module, lead validation for all types of testing and support activities related to implementation, transition, and warranty. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.  

  

Candidate must be located within commuting distance of **Bridgewater NJ, Jersey City NJ & New York NY** or be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel to project locations.

title: Dental Assistant
description:
**About us**

Advanced Periodontics of New Jersey is located in River Edge, NJ. We are a professional, agile and innovative team. Our goal is to expand our harmonious, communicative team that focuses on an outstanding patient experience. .

Our work environment includes:

* Modern office setting

\\*\\*Overview:\\*\\*

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Dental Assistant to join our team in a state-of-the-art periodontal practice. As a Dental Assistant, you will play a vital role in providing exceptional patient care while supporting the dental professionals on our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in assisting with dental procedures and have a passion for delivering excellent patient experiences. We utilize lasers for periodontal treatment. Our ideal applicant will have a thirst for growth and learning about surgical procedures including but not limited to placing implants, sinus lifts and grafting.

title: Experienced Surgery Veterinary Technician
description:
**Who we are:**

Eclipse Specialty & Emergency Pet Care is a new, privately/employee-owned state-of-the-art specialty and emergency hospital located in Whippany, NJ. Eclipse offers 24/7 emergency care, as well as critical care, internal medicine, oncology, surgery, and neurology services! Eclipse was founded by 3 Board-Certified Specialist Veterinarians and a Licensed Veterinary Technician who all share a common vision, which is to nurture, develop, and support the passion and power of their team, so that they, in return, can provide extraordinary care for pets and the people who love them.

Sitting on approximately 6 acres, our new, naturally lit hospital was designed by our founders with our patients', clients', and team members' comfort and safety in mind. Surrounded by wetlands and park space and furnished with modern and cozy furniture, Eclipse is a beautiful and truly unique place to work.

**What makes Eclipse different?**

At Eclipse, yesterday’s family culture meets tomorrow’s medicine. Eclipse was founded on the simple belief that people, their pets, and the team members who care for them deserve something more, and our values are at the forefront of everything we do. We employ only top talent and industry leading clinicians. We perform modern, state-of-the-art procedures and provide world-class care. We have all the fun toys: CT, MRI, Ultrasound, in house laboratory equipment, you name it! On top of that, we put OUR people first. A great workplace culture is the essence of who we are. We only hire people who have integrity, respect for their coworkers, are compassionate to pets and their owners, and want to continue to learn and grow professionally! We offer industry-leading compensation and shift differentials, CE, health insurance, 401k, pet discounts, AND members of our start-up team will receive unit appreciation rights to reward you for your hard work and help in making the hospital successful!

**Who we’re looking for...**

Eclipse Veterinary Care is seeking a veterinary technician with experience working in a veterinary anesthesia specialty department, like Neurology or Surgery. At Eclipse, our neurology and surgery team are combined into one large anesthesia service. Our team members utilize advanced imaging like CT and MRI and work on a wide variety of cases, including orthopedic procedures, soft tissue surgeries, spinal surgeries, and craniotomies.

The ideal candidate is motivated to work on challenging yet meaningful work that has the potential to reshape our profession. Our team consists of a group of diverse and talented individuals who share our principles for excellence in patient care, as well as our passion to work and evolve together and to help and support each other for the sake of our collective goals. A healthy work environment that promotes research and collaborative care is a top priority for our organization. Our team is leading the way to provide the best care possible for our patients.

**What’s in it for you?**

We are building an organization that reflects our responsibility to care for our team as individuals, which means you can expect:

* Generous paid time off (PTO) begins to accrue on your first day
* Competitive salaries and shift differentials
* 401K plans
* Health insurance
* Uniform allowance
* AtDove membership
* Access to a number of free wellness and mental health resources
* Transparent and supportive leadership
* Meaningful work in an innovative and sustainable work environment

If any of the above resonates with you, excites you, or sounds like a cause you want to be a part of, apply today.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

* Veterinary technician experience: 3 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Veterinary Technician Certification (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Whippany, NJ 07981: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: 2025 Guardian Summer Intern, Integrated Marketing Sports Sponsorship
description:
2025 Guardian Summer Intern, Integrated Marketing Sports Sponsorship
Our 2025 Internship Program is a paid 10-week learning experience where you will be immersed in the daily environment of a thriving global financial services company. You will gain invaluable industry and organizational knowledge through daily business interactions and job assignments, in addition to engaging in projects that directly affect our business, interact with senior leaders in conversational settings, and network with employees and interns across our offices. This 10-week internship provides you with realistic experiences and information of what it is like to work at Guardian.
Internship Dates:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2, 2025- Friday, August 8, 2025.
We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. The application window will close on Sunday, November 17th, 2024, at 11:59PM ET or when role(s) have been filled, whichever comes first.
You are:
A rising senior (graduation date of December 2025- June 2026) who is fueled by collaboration, able to listen and make quick decisions and thrive in a goal-oriented environment.
Location (housing is not provided):* Stamford, CT
* New York, NY


You have:* A concentration in marketing, communications, or business
* A foundational understanding of a marketing basics and building a marketing plan
* Drive to be a valuable contributor and will to help in any way
* Interest in learning about sports/sponsorship / partnership marketing
* Strong organizational and project management skills
* Clear communication skills
* A commitment to collaborate


You will:* Partner with marketing leaders to develop and activate our sponsorship and partnership plans
* Learn how to build multi-channel, integrated marketing plans from start to finish including partnering with consumer research and insights and key colleague groups in brand, creative, media, social, digital, measurement and more
* Have the opportunity to learn about all facets of marketing and communications
* Develop and manage detailed project plans
* Organize and manage events / activations
* Build presentations and present plans to leadership
* Have the opportunity to work and learn from supportive leaders, mentors and team members across the organization who will help coach you as you develop your professional career
* Learn about Guardian’s purpose, values, how we work, and our suite of product and service offerings
* Build a network of colleagues and have a sense of community with other interns and other parts of the business
* Think broadly and ask questions about data, facts and other information
* Be a self-starter – someone who enjoys “rolling up their sleeves and getting things done”, has high energy, strong work ethic, displays the ability to work independently, and is creative


We offer:* Meaningful and challenging work opportunities to accelerate innovation in a secure and compliant way
* Dynamic, modern work environments that promote collaboration and creativity to develop and empower talent
* Employee Resource Groups that advocate for inclusion and diversity in all that we do
* Social responsibility in all aspects of our work- we volunteer within our local communities, create educational alliances with colleges, and drive a variety of initiatives in sustainability


Eligibility:* Applicants must be eligible to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment-based work authorization. F-1 visa holders with Optional Practical Training (OPT) who will require H-1B status, TNs, or current H-1B visa holders will not be considered. H1-B and green card sponsorship are not available for this position.
* You must be available for the full 10 weeks of the internship program.


If you have any questions regarding the application process, please feel free to email Guardian\\_Campus@glic.com.

The salary for this position ultimately will be determined based on the education, experience, knowledge, and abilities of the successful candidate. In addition to salary, this role may also be eligible for annual, sales, or other incentive compensation.
Our Promise
At Guardian, you’ll have the support and flexibility to achieve your professional and personal goals. Through skill-building, leadership development and philanthropic opportunities, we provide opportunities to build communities and grow your career, surrounded by diverse colleagues with high ethical standards.
Inspire Well-Being
As part of Guardian’s Purpose – to inspire well-being – we are committed to offering contemporary, supportive, flexible, and inclusive benefits and resources to our colleagues.

title: Copywriter
description:
**Company Description**  

Saatchi & Saatchi is a globally connected, full-service agency that has created fervent communities around the best brands on the planet for decades with one wholehearted belief - *Nothing is Impossible*.

 **Job Description**  

Saatchi & Saatchi New York is looking for a copywriter to join our highly awarded creative department. This person should be curious, competitive and ambitious. Must be able to be in the NYC office. This is not a remote role.


They immerse themselves in everyday brands, culture and the creative industry. They may have already picked up some awards in their career so far and they keen to make a name for themselves.


This person obsesses about the details. Someone who can think outside of their own comfort zone and be flexible in a fast paced environment. This person will be a conceptual 360 thinker across a variety of briefs.

 **Qualifications**  

* 3+ years of copywriting experience within a creative environment.
* Knowledgeable on what type of content performs well across the different channels.
* Work within a team to conceptualize and execute a variety of original projects across all media channels (Social, banners, TV, radio, stunts, etc)
* Write copy for existing campaign extensions.
* Bring emotional copywriting and a high level of craft.
* Passionate about social media platforms, trends, technology and best practices
* Concept at the ‘big idea’ level and bring strategic thought leadership throughout your work.
* Excellent organizational and communication skills
* Ability to prioritize and multi-task
* Be a collaborative team player, working in a Power of One groupe agency model.
* A “maker” mentality, be curious and not afraid to try new methods.
* Attention to detail and confidence in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment
* Love and champion our work and brands

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 08/21/2024.

description:
The Field Operations Technician will be a member of a cross-functional team performing day-to-day activities in the disciplines of plant operations, pipeline damage prevention, gas measurement and maintenance/compliance tasks associated with high pressure gas pipeline systems.

Individual will be a multi-skilled employee performing a variety of operational and maintenance tasks associated with 24/7 operations of assigned facilities including pipeline safeguarding, measurement, corrosion, and compression to assure continuity of operations, operability of engines, compressors, cooling equipment, pumps, valves, fittings, and other associated equipment.

This position is safety-sensitive and subject to random drug and alcohol testing.

**Responsibilities**

* Assist and perform preventative maintenance on operational equipment at assigned facilities.
* Recognize abnormal operating conditions.
* Operate work equipment including but not limited to power tools, hand tools, and specialized instruments used in pipeline operations, maintenance, and repair of facilities.
* Must be able and willing to work overtime, weekends, shift, be on call and standby, and travel overnight as required.
* Complete weekly, monthly, annual compliance documentation.
* Review and interprets drawings, sketches and as-builts.
* Troubleshoot equipment malfunctions
* Perform work in compliance with Company policies/procedures as well as external regulatory bodies, such as Pipeline Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA) and Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) through adherence to Operating Procedures and Operation and Maintenance (O&M) Manuals.
* Participate in and maintain ongoing on the job and Operator Qualification (OQ) training and certifications.

**Qualifications:**

* Currently resides or is willing to relocate to Long Island, NY and work from home office.
* Technical high school diploma is preferred.
* Must have a Valid Driver’s License and good driving record.
* Training or experience with Electrical and/or Mechanical systems
* Exposure or familiarity with RTU’s PLC’s MCC’s and other electrical and control systems preferred.
* Possesses the desire to learn and advance as a Pipeline Technician.
* Computer literate with working knowledge of Excel and Word.
* Strong technical and analytical skills demonstrated through training, formal education, and/or experience.
* Able to work independently with little to no direction.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
* Able to work and contribute to a team environment where inclusiveness, integrity, honesty, and openness are valued.
* Innovative problem solver without compromising procedure and policy.
* Willing to assume responsibility and take initiative to resolve issues

Iroquois provides equal opportunity in employment to qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, physical or mental disability, marital status, national origin, ancestry, veteran status, predisposing genetic characteristics or any other legally protected class or factor in accordance with applicable state or federal laws The Company complies with all laws regarding reasonable accommodation of disabilities for applicants and employees. If you believe you may need reasonable accommodation at any point during the application process (or after, if hired), please contact the Manager, Human Resources.

title: Interim Director of Music
description:
The Unitarian Universalist Congregation in Westport (TUUCW) is seeking an individual to join our team as Interim Director of Music. This is a part-time position of twenty hours per week from January through June of 2025.

The primary responsibilities of the Interim Director of Music will be to collaborate with the Senior Minister in planning a diverse overall program and leading the adult choirs. This involves rehearsals each week on Monday and Thursday evenings and participation Sunday mornings. In addition to typical Sunday services, there may be all-music services and events at other times.

The Interim Director of Music will teach choral technique to the adult choirs, will teach the music in rehearsal and will conduct these choirs during Sunday services. This individual will manage communications with choir members and will encourage the growth of the Music Program.

The Interim Director of Music will report to the Senior Minister and will manage the overall calendar for music in Sunday services. This person will collaborate with the Senior Minister to select diverse repertoire for choirs and other types and styles of music. He or she will coordinate the involvement of guest artists and will coordinate with the Co-Assistant Directors of Music who manage the Teen and Bell choirs and the children’s Chapel Singers choir. This person will manage the budget for the Music Program with the Senior Minister or his designee. The Interim Director of Music will work closely with staff to coordinate smoothly running Sunday services.

The right candidate for this position will:

- Be ready to fully embrace being part of the team of staff and lay leaders who deliver the elements of robust holistic congregational life of which music is a fundamental, integral part.

- Create a safe place where all members of the congregation celebrate the joy of singing and creating all kinds of music together.

- Embrace and enjoy a diverse musical repertoire and overall program that reflects the diversity of tastes, experiences and ages among the congregation.

- Be dynamic, energetic and ready to convey a passion for music to all

- Be engaging and promote a love of choral singing, teaching good choral practices and discipline while making rehearsals and Sunday performances rewarding.

- Have keyboarding skills sufficient to teach the parts and to accompany choirs during rehearsals; additional keyboard expertise is a plus.

The Unitarian Universalist Congregation in Westport is a diverse and welcoming religious community, free of creed and dogma, and open to people of all backgrounds and beliefs. Unitarian Universalism is a “living tradition” that draws upon the wisdom of the world’s religions. The Music Program at TUUCW reflects the diversity of our congregation and our worship practices. All genres of music are included.

To apply, submit a resume and cover letter to

tuucwdom@gmail.com

For more information, contact

tuucwdom@gmail.com

For specific questions, contact

Rev. Alan Taylor, Senior Minister alan@uuwestport.org

Learn more about The Unitarian Universalist Congregation in Westport at uuwestport.org

Start date: January 1, 2025

Location: 10 Lyons Plains Road, Westport, Connecticut and Work at Home

Type of employment: Regular Part-time Employee, 20 Hours per week, Temporary - January 2025-June 2025

Reporting to: Senior Minister

Compensation: $40 - 45 per hour

Applications will be accepted through September 2024

In the Spring of 2025, the Interim Director of Music may apply for the permanent position of Director of Music which will be effective in September 2025. More details about that position will be available early in 2025. Whether or not a candidate is interested in applying for this position is not a factor in considering candidates for the Interim position.

title: Chief Estimator
description:
**Job Description:**

Have final word on procedures, processes, techniques and personnel decisions for the estimating process. The Chief Estimator works with the Management and Vice President of operations to oversee department standards for deliverables such as bid packages, deliverable formats and budget tracking tools.

Manage and coordinate the people, software and other resources used to perform the estimating functions. Projects range from fully defined projects to conceptual and alternative procurement such as Design-Build Projects.

* Assigns responsibilities for estimating team on each project
* Reviews project plans and specifications and coordinates with the team to confirm complete scope
* Identify risk issues and their order of magnitude
* Solicit subcontractor and/or supplier information & pricing
* Assist in “Good Faith Efforts” as required
* Prepares instructions to bidders, bid form and other bid solicitation information as required
* Performs and/or manages the quantity survey and pricing effort for internal budgets
* Prepares conceptual budgets based on minimal information
* Reviews general conditions, schedule, scopes of work, hoisting plans, site logistics and other exhibits as prepared by Operations
* Ensures the flow of project information is maintained and documented
* Reviews and/or manages the review and scoping of specialty contractor bids
* Coordinates insurance requirements with Risk Manager
* Coordinates technical proposal requirements with Marketing Department
* Coordinates technical proposal requirements with Marketing Department
* Reviews constructability issues with operational staff
* Assist project personnel on successful proposals as follows: Participate in the transfer of information on successful projects including the Job Kick-off Meeting; Assist in the preparation and review of work plans as requested; Participate in periodic reviews and visits to projects as appropriate; Pricing of change impacts as required
* Maintains and communicates data on construction and material cost trends affecting project costs
* Analyze alternate means and methods to determine the most economic alternative
* Builds effective relationships with customers, design team, specialty contractors, suppliers, and user groups that reflect and support company core values and meets or exceeds the customer's expectations
* Actively participates in industry, client and community relations to enhance company image
* Actively participates in industry, client and community relations to enhance company image
* Performs other related duties as needed.

\\*  
**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Administration or related from an accredited institution and 15 or more years estimating or project experience on building projects valued at 200 million or more.
* Proficiency in all computer software programs used in estimating with particular emphasis on Timberline, OST, Revit estimating software
* Possess strong mathematical and computer skills. Proficiency with all MS Office products (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint)
* Ability to breakdown construction operations into a logical sequence of activities
* Ability to work in a team environment
* Ability to professionally communicate the basis for individual work product when in a highly stressed environment
* Ability and willingness to abide by Tutor Perini / policies on a daily basis environment.
* Must be able to meet deadlines and put in the time needed to get the job done.
* Must be willing to travel
* Good attention to detail with the ability to recognize discrepancies.
* Candidates must possess a strong work ethic with strong organization skills
* Excellent written and verbal skills

Job Type: Full-time

title: Financial Controller
description:
Join Advanced Recovery Group (ARG), a leading financial services firm revolutionizing collections solutions for commercial financing companies nationwide. Experience the epitome of a modern workplace, where quarterly bonuses, frequent company outings, sponsored lunches, and even a company therapy dog await you.

Amidst our rapid expansion, we're seeking an individual with exceptional organizational and accounting prowess to spearhead our financial operations. As our dedicated Financial Controller, you'll be instrumental in maintaining and optimizing our financials, from meticulous tracking and reconciliation to comprehensive payroll management and client remittances.

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform timely reconciliation of all accounts as required.
* Compile and analyze account data to prepare accurate accounting records.
* Utilize QuickBooks and Simplicity Collect for precise posting of financial transactions.
* Monitor debits and credits across accounts with precision.
* Collaborate closely with the CEO on financial strategies and reporting.
* Generate essential financial reports such as balance sheets and income statements.
* Ensure accuracy of financial records and promptly address any discrepancies.
* Manage accounts receivable including invoicing, deposits, collections, and revenue recognition.
* Execute payroll functions accurately and punctually, including tax submissions.
* Interpret and apply accounting standards and regulations to ensure compliance.

**Qualifications:**

* Thorough understanding of accounting principles, financial statements, and QuickBooks.
* Advanced proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel, with hands-on experience in pivot tables, etc.
* Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication abilities.
* Keen attention to detail and adept at prioritizing tasks effectively.
* Ability to work autonomously and collaboratively within a team.
* Minimum of 3 years experience in an Accountant or Controller role.

Join ARG and be part of a dynamic team shaping the future of financial services while enjoying a supportive work environment and exciting perks. If you're ready to make an impact and thrive in a stimulating atmosphere, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and embark on a rewarding career journey with us.

title: Case Manager BHH
description:
**Organizational Overview:**  

CarePlus New Jersey continues to be a leader in mental health and a pioneer in integrated care in Northern New Jersey for more than 45 years. CarePlus strives for excellence in mental health, addiction recovery, and community-based services. Our goal is to offer affordable, accessible, and holistic-centered care that empowers individuals to reach their full potential and enhance their quality of life.


**Job Summary:**  

Provide comprehensive care management, care coordination, health promotion, comprehensive transitional care, individual and family support services, and referral to community and social support services through person-centered care planning.

  

**What You Will Do:**


* Engage consumers and their families
* Facilitate and coordinate psycho-educational services (including groups) for consumers and their family members on a variety of topics relating to wellness
* Offer on-site as well as outreach services (including transport of consumers)
* Fulfill case management services
* Ensure consumers have community support in place that fulfill a positive corroborative role
* Communicate observations and information about the consumer in the consumer's service record and to team members
* Engage in supportive counseling and crisis intervention
* Participates in the assessment and evaluation of consumers at intake/admissions, during ongoing recovery/service delivery, and at discharge
* Collaborate with team and collaborative treatment providers to establish comprehensive bio-psycho-social assessments and care plans
* Participate in quality assurance activities and cross-functional action teams

  

**What We Need to See:**


* Bachelor's degree in a related field
* Two (2) years experience working within a health care or behavioral health setting; Experience working with adults with acute symptoms of mental illness and with chronic health care conditions.
* A valid driver's license and must be insurable by the agency's automobile insurance

  

**What We Offer:**

  

* Health, Dental and Vision
* Life & AD&D insurance; STD & LTD coverage
* Generous Vacation, Personal, and Sick time
* Competitive Hourly Wages and Premium Holiday Compensation
* 401k Plan and Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Discount and Rewards Program

  

**About CarePlus New Jersey:**  

*CPNJ embraces a culture of diversity and inclusion in all of it policies and procedures. Care Plus follows Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, et seq and NJ Law Against Discrimination.* *We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by Federal and State laws.*
